availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Hopkinsville, Kentucky, attorney. Virginia native. Married Gabriella L. Buckner. Father of Gabriel Lewis Buckner, Lucy M. Buckner, and James F. Buckner, Jr. Attorney in Hopkinsville in 1850 and 1860. Owned nine enslaved people in Christian County in 1850. Owned sixty-one enslaved people in Hopkinsville in 1860. Elected colonel of unorganized recruits for the United States Army near Hopkinsville, Kentucky, in August 1861. Captured by the Confederate States Army in September 1861.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Christian County, Town of Hopkinsville, p. 427. Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Christian County, District No. 2. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Christian County, Town of Hopkinsville, p. 44. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Christian County, Town of Hopkinsville, pp. 30-31. The Union Army: States and Regiments, Vol. IV (Madison, Wis.: Federal Publishing Company, 1908), 344.
